sentences.en: Before the war, Munk had been studying oceanography, so he took his concerns to his mentor, Harald Sverdrup, then director of Scripps and widely regarded as the top oceanographer in the US.
sentences.cn: 战前，芒克一直在研究海洋学，他很关注他的导师--哈拉尔斯维德鲁普，在他的指导下芒克很快成为美国顶尖海洋学家。

sentences.en: In 1904 Johannes Schmidt, a young Danish oceanographer and biologist, got a job aboard the Thor, a Danish research vessel, studying the breeding habits of food fishes such as cod and herring.
sentences.cn: 年轻的丹麦海洋学家兼生物学家乔纳斯·施密特在丹麦研究船“托尔”号上找到一份工作，研究食用鱼（如鳕鱼和鲱鱼）的繁殖习性。

sentences.en: Legendary oceanographer once described the tiny 12 - hectare island as " an untouched piece of art. "
sentences.cn: 传奇式的海洋学家曾形容这个微型的12公顷小岛为自然界 “ 未受人为影响的艺术创造. ”

sentences.en: She was a distinguished oceanographer, and a gifted painter into the bargain.
sentences.cn: 她是一位杰出的海洋学家, 同时还是一位很有才华的画家.

sentences.en: That answer comes from biological oceanographer Nancy Rabalais of the Louisiana Universities Marine Consortium.
sentences.cn: 您正在收听的是路易斯安那大学海事协会海洋生物学家南希·拉尔莱的讲话.

sentences.en: The oceanographer told delegates that the problem of ocean acidification was worse in high latitudes, in the Arctic and around Antarctica, than it was nearer the equator.
sentences.cn: 这位海洋学家告诉与会代表，高纬度地区的海洋酸化问题更加严重，北极和南极周围比赤道附近糟糕得多。

sentences.en: You are listening to University of Georgia oceanographer Mandy Joye.
sentences.cn: 您听到的是对乔治亚大学海洋学家曼迪?乔伊的采访.

words.tran_cn: 海洋的；海洋产出的；在海洋中生活的；广阔无垠的
